DOC.detailed_description: This multicenter prospective follow-up study patient first episode symptomatic idiopathic venous thromboembolism ( proximal deep vein thrombosis and/or pulmonary embolism ) treat vitamin K antagonist ( either warfarin acenocoumarol ) minimum 3 month . Eligible patient give informed consent instruct immediately stop oral anticoagulation refrain take antithrombotic drug next visit , schedule 30 day . At visit , venous blood sample perform D-dimer assay thrombophilia test . D-dimers assess use Clearview Simplify D-dimer assay ( Agen Biomedical Limited , Brisbane , Australia ) . Patients normal D-dimer result continue anticoagulation , whereas elevate D-dimer result randomize use computer program either stop resume anticoagulation vitamin K antagonist ( INR 2.0-3.0 ) . All patient followed-up 18 month . The study outcome composite confirm recurrent venous thromboembolism major bleed event . All suspect outcome event death evaluate central adjudication committee whose member unaware D-dimer thrombophilia result group assignment .
